pullrequest.title: Updates to RemoteWorker and similar classes

content.raw:
I guess what I was getting at is that BLACS on a local machine and BLACS on a remote machine are both special cases of BLACS on a some machine, so they should not be made different in implementation or syntax.

In the short term I think that my line of comments should be IGNORED, because it sounds like I think that there should be a difference between a dispatching mechanism that does not do any hardware (i.e., is not BLACS) and a series of BLACS "RemoteBLACS" instances both with and without the UI.  Right now BLACS combines these functions in a way that makes sense on one machine, but not with many.
